definitions.definition: to come or go back to a previous place:
examples: Odysseus returned home/returned to his home after many years of travelling.

definitions.definition: If people or things return to a previous condition, they go back to that condition:
examples: Within a week, the situation had returned to normal.

definitions.definition: If you return to an activity or subject, you start doing it or talking about it again:
examples: Gandhi urged Indians to return to spinning their own yarn.

definitions.definition: an occasion when someone goes or comes back to a place where they were before:
examples: The whole town came out to celebrate his return (from the war).

definitions.definition: an occasion when you start to do or have something again:
examples: Some environmentalists argue for a return to a pre-industrial society.

definitions.definition: a ticket for travel to a place and back again:
The return part of a journey is the part in which you go back to the place where you started:
examples: The return journey took longer because the train was rerouted.
